paper_abstract: We study randomized algorithms for numerical integration with respect to a product probability measure on the sequence space R-N. We consider integrands from reproducing kernel Hilbert spaces, whose kernels are superpositions of weighted tensor products. We combine tractability results for finite-dimensional integration with the multi-level technique to construct new algorithms for infinite-dimensional integration. These algorithms use variable subspace sampling, and we compare the power of variable and fixed subspace sampling by an analysis of minimal errors. (C) 2010 Elsevier Inc. All rights reserved.
paper_title: Multi-level Monte Carlo algorithms for infinite-dimensional integration on R-N
